definition: a jointed or flexible device on which a door, lid, or other swinging part turns
a small piece of thin gummed paper used in fastening a postage stamp in an album
to swing on or as if on a hinge
examples: These thoughtful amenities include … an outdoor patio TV that hinges outward toward the pool …
… we pulled within feet of a 12-foot crocodile, his huge jaw hinging open in warning to reveal a toothy grin.

definition: to be contingent on a single consideration or point
examples: the prosecution's case hinges on the DNA evidence

definition: to attach by or furnish with hinges
